author: agemanning
content: <@!363800010518822915> and others. I think prysm has recently shifted to ipv6. In discv5 pong responses we are now seeing ipv6 addresses being returned. These addresses are ipv4 addresses mapped to ipv6, which has caused some headaches. Is this a recent update in prysm <@!363800010518822915> ?

author: nishant0
content: Hey, we added in a change to allow discovery for nodes with an ipv6 address. Previously it didnt work very well with a host ipv6 address

author: nishant0
content: So lighthouse nodes are sending out ping messages from an ipv6 address ?

author: agemanning
content: We are sending out ping messages from an ipv4 address, and seem to be getting pong responses of ipv6 address of the form: ::ffff:203.123.20.31. I.e ipv4 addresses translated to ipv6

author: nishant0
content: Hmm, that shouldnt be possible. Let me double check on our end
